etymology.description: Depicts a surface or the skin of an animal
etymology.interpretation: The character 皮(皮) (pí, 'surface') visually represents an animal hide or skin stretched out, emphasizing the idea of an outer covering or surface. It captures the concept of a boundary between the interior and exterior, as seen in animal skins used as material.

examples.chinese: 这张桌子的皮很光滑(這張桌子的皮很光滑)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zhāng zhuōzi de pí hěn guānghuá.
examples.english: The surface of this table is very smooth.

examples.chinese: 新鞋的皮非常柔软(新鞋的皮非常柔軟)，适合长时间行走(適合長時間行走)。
examples.pinyin: Xīn xié de pí fēicháng róuruǎn, shìhé cháng shíjiān xíngzǒu.
examples.english: The surface of the new shoes is very soft and suitable for long walks.
